Unfortunately in the year 2021, there's barely any servers and not a lot of players playing anymore.
This's a dead game now, which's a big shame.
It's a small game (roughly 44MB) and can be played on just about any computer, and has the arsenal present in HL1, but unfortunately the players seemed to of moved on.
If you do decide to pick it up, make sure to invite some friends that also own it to get the most out of it.  However, as it stands, I cannot recommend spending $5 on this, even if it's on sale.

VALVE DID IT DIRTY

A tribute to Quake from Valve. 

When you play this game, you will see that Deathmatch Classic is heavily inspired by id Software's Quake. From the weapons, to the maps and sounds there is a great deal of inspiration taken. Except the player models are the standard models that can be found in Half-Life Deathmatch.

You‚Äôll never really find anybody playing this game. Especially when compared to Ricochet (another dead Valve game) where you‚Äôd occasionally find players on at random times of the day. 

The last time I found somebody playing this game on a server was probably when I bought it and played it for the first time. (Also the reason why the reviews for this game seem to be mixed at the time of writing this review 25/9/21)

It is a good game but I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth spending money on unless you buy it in a pack during a Steam sale. (That is how I have my copy).

This game is from what I can tell just the mutliplayer of the Original Quake but in GoldSource. It plays decent and if you can find someone you can have some fun but overall due to it being just the multiplayer of quake that's probably the better option.

The game is Valve's tribute to Quake. The gameplay is similar to Quake with all the same weapons and pickups except for the Half-Life's trademark crowbar as a melee weapon. The game is very fun to play and you can get into it pretty easily. Learning some of the most advanced techniques mimicked from Quake such as bunnyhopping can be tough to learn but other than that the game is not hard at all to play. However, the game doesn't really have that many active players and you won't have the same kind of fun playing it as Valve's other titles. On the whole, the game is fun but gets repetitive later on.

This game is esentially Half-Life: Deathmatch with Quake 1 maps and weapons, so if you love Half-Life: Deathmatch and/or Quake, then this game is for you. 

However, if you want to play with real players (not bots), I suggest you not to buy this and play Half-Life: Deathmatch instead. It's unfortunate to see that this game could be a great potential, but unfortunately, literally almost no one cares about this game anymore.

Quake deathmatch in the Goldsrc engine! Yes it's as fun as it sounds. Unfortunate this one never really took off. An absolute blast if you can get some friends to play with. This is a game that is ACTUALLY dead online. Stick to Quake live, folks.

While the addition of Weapon Categories is nice, I'm going to have to say no to this one.

[b]It's not bad at all[/b]--let me make that clear--but it's an inferior experience to Quake 1 (which this game is a clone of), and that is already subjectively an inferior experience to Quake 3 and Live.

My main reason for this is that Quake 1 is Free Software under the GNU GPLv2, and therefore there are tons of alternative forks of it (called "source ports" by the Doom and Quake communities). They often bring the games into a more modern state that make them run better on newer computers and work better on exotic setups. GoldSrc is proprietary and does not offer any of this, and it's also still using the old Vert- FOV BS that games have been using for the past 20+ years. This poses a serious problem when playing at any aspect ratio above 4:3. Additionally, Deathmatch Classic does not offer anything significant over the original Quake 1 deathmatch. All it is is a lazy port of Quake to the outdated GoldSrc engine. It doesn't even have the fun bhopping physics of the original. 

In conclusion, while it is worth more than the $5 asking price, it's only when not considering it's superior competitors which you can get [b][i]free of charge[/i][/b]. This isn't Valve's creation and the id Software fanbase is already offering a better experience. You can literally download the nQuake source port and be playing online in seconds without paying a single penny and it comes with the Team Fortress mod included for servers that support it, rendering Deathmatch Classic 100% obsolete. Fan-made idTech source ports being FOSS means that they offer unmatched levels of customization. The original shareware releases of Quake, plus the HD modpacks etc, already contain all the assets you need to play online.

There is absolutely zero reason to invest money in DMC, and unless you're trying to get the entire Valve collection for bragging rights, you are wasting your money.
You get to use the half life weapons and some others against your friends, it's kinda like team fortress classic without the team part.

This game saved my life.

I am 38.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realise that.

Thank you

-Old graphics
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Do I recommend Deathmatch Classic?

Games dead but pretty fun with friends

This is kind of weird. So, Half-Life is based on a tweaked version of the idTech engine used for Quake, and Deathmatch Classic is literally Valve's take on Quake. I say take, but it's literally just Half-Life mechanics with Quake maps. Quite frankly, it doesn't work, just because it didn't feel like they accounted for the map designs and Quake's original mechanics when adding in the Half-Life mechanics. Not to mention, many people aren't playing this game anymore, while you'll see more people playing Quake these days. Overall, get Quake and get a multiplayer source port, and not this.

Make no mistake; this game is definitely dead. It was probably dead when it came out. I think it deserves a little better, though. Valve obviously loved Quake 1 and this was their tribute. It's basically just vanilla QuakeWorld with some convenience stuff added and just ever-so-slightly slower and with slightly more modern graphics. I could see myself playing this a lot if anyone else did.
